node.title: Susan Neill-Fraser's second appeal against her murder conviction has been dismissed. What comes next?
node.alt: A graphic of Bob Chappell, Susan Neill-Fraser and the Four Winds yacht..
node.description: Susan Neill-Fraser's second appeal against her murder conviction has failed —  but it's the dissenting opinion of one justice that could provide a pathway for her case to reach the High Court, writes Loretta Lohberger.
node.content:
["Susan Neill-Fraser's second appeal against her murder conviction has failed, but it was not a unanimous decision by the Court of Criminal Appeal.", "Her family and supporters say they have found some hope in Justice Stephen Estcourt's dissenting opinion, which was published on Tuesday alongside Justice Helen Wood and Justice Robert Pearce's reasons for dismissing Neill-Fraser's appeal.", "A Supreme Court jury in 2010 found Neill-Fraser guilty of murdering her partner, Bob Chappell, 65, on board the couple's yacht the Four Winds, on Australia Day 2009.", "Neill-Fraser's 2012 appeal against her conviction was dismissed, but a law change in 2015 enabled her to mount a second appeal on the ground that she had \"fresh and compelling evidence\" and had a reasonable case to present to the court.", "The evidence relied on during the appeal hearing concerned questions about how DNA from Meaghan Vass, then a homeless teenager, came to be on the deck of the Four Winds, something that was dismissed as a \"red herring\" by the prosecution at Neill-Fraser's 2010 trial.", "Outside the court on Tuesday, Neill-Fraser's supporters said they were disappointed with the court's decision to dismiss the appeal, but they vowed to fight on.", "\"It will not be [over]\u00a0until Sue Neill-Fraser's name is cleared,\" former Tasmanian premier Lara Giddings, a supporter of Neill-Fraser, said.", "", "
Susan Neill-Fraser was convicted of murdering Bob Chappell but has always maintained her innocence.(AAP/Supplied)
", "
Dissenting decision could provide High Court avenue
", "Neill-Fraser's daughter Sarah Bowles said Justice Estcourt's dissenting decision provided \"an opportunity to explore options within the justice system further\".", "Neill-Fraser's legal team is reviewing the court's decision and had no comment to make after the decision was handed down.", "An option for Neill-Fraser could be to apply to the High Court for special leave for it to hear an appeal against the Court of Criminal Appeal's decision.", "Justice Estcourt's comments could provide a basis for an application to the High Court.", "", "
Susan Neill-Fraser smiled at her family and supporters who were seated in court.(ABC News: Joshua Santospirito)
", "Cardinal George Pell's appeal against child sexual abuse convictions to the Victorian Court of Appeal failed, but one of the judges dissented. Cardinal Pell then took his case to the High Court where his appeal was successful.", "Historian Jenny Hocking also managed a successful High Court appeal against a Federal Court appeal decision\u00a0that was decided 2-1.", "Ms Hocking's case concerned the release of letters exchanged by former governor-general Sir John Kerr and the Queen at the time of the dismissal of the Whitlam government. She initially lost a Federal Court case to access the letters.\u00a0", "Ms Bowles said she would be \"leaning on\" her mother's pro bono legal team \u2014 which includes Robert Richter QC, Chris Carr SC, and Paul Galbally \u2014 for advice on \"how best to pursue justice for mum\", but she acknowledged the appeal process was limited.", "", "
Susan Neill-Fraser's daughter Sarah Bowles said the outcome of the appeal was disappointing.\u00a0(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "Since the trial, Ms Vass has given various accounts \u2014 both inside and outside court \u2014 of where she was or was not on the night of Mr Chappell's murder, including that she was on board the yacht when Mr Chappell was murdered and that Neill-Fraser was not there.", "Evidence from Ms Vass herself was abandoned during the appeal hearing in March after she recanted her evidence under cross-examination.", "Neill-Fraser's supporters say Ms Vass needed protection from the court, particularly that the names of the people she said were on the yacht should have been suppressed, and that Ms Vass should have been given immunity from prosecution.", "
Renewed calls for case to be re-examined
", "", "
Former Tasmanian premier and supporter\u00a0Lara Giddings wants to see the case re-examined.
", "Also speaking outside the court on Tuesday, Ms Giddings renewed the supporter group's call for a commission of inquiry to examine the case.", "She said she did not expect the government to support a commission of inquiry, but that there was some interest in the parliament, particularly in the Legislative Council, to \"start a process of investigating this matter\", which could lead to a commission of inquiry.", "\"We will be continuing to work with the upper house in the hope that we will get an inquiry that will allow a number of the issues that cannot and are not allowed to be exposed in the court to be exposed in the parliament, the place of the people,\" she said.", "Regardless of what the Court of Criminal Appeal decided this week, it was never going to be the end of the matter.", "For Bob Chappell's family, they will always have to live with the grief of his murder."]
